title: How to Make Your Hair Smooth and Shiny with Milk and Eggs

steps.title: Mix 1 egg and 1 c (240 mL) of milk together in a bowl.
steps.content: Mix 1 egg and 1 c (240 mL) of milk together in a bowl. Stir the egg into the milk until the yolk is totally broken up and the mixture has an even consistency. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Apply the mixture
steps.content: Apply the mixture to your hair. Scoop a little bit of the egg mixture in your hand and massage it into your scalp. Then, continue to work the mask into your strands. [3] X Research source It helps to apply the mask in sections, especially if you have long hair. Massage the mask into your hair from root to tip. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Cover your hair and wait 1 hour.
steps.content: Cover your hair and wait 1 hour. Tie up your mask-treated hair and cover it completely with a plastic shower cap . Let the mask sit for about an hour so it has plenty of time to soak into your hair. [5] X Research source No shower cap? No problem! Just slip a loose, clean plastic bag over your head and hold it in place with a stretchy rubber band. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Rinse out the mask in the shower.
steps.content: Rinse out the mask in the shower. Using cool water, rinse out your hair with a mild shampoo and conditioner. Keep rinsing out your hair until the egg and milk mixture is completely gone. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Combine 2 US tbsp (30 mL) of both milk and honey with an egg yolk.
steps.content: Combine 2 US tbsp (30 mL) of both milk and honey with an egg yolk. Whisk the ingredients together by hand, or mix everything together in a food processor to make it really smooth and blended. Just be sure to separate the egg yolk before adding it to the mixture! [8] X Research source Is your hair especially oily or dry? No worries—this mask works well for all different hair varieties.

steps.title: Rub the mixture into your hair while it’s damp.
steps.content: Rub the mixture into your hair while it’s damp. Take a quick shower and towel-dry your hair a little bit, as this mask works best when your hair is slightly wet. Apply the mixture to your roots, really working it into your scalp as much as you can. Then, massage the mask into the strands of your hair until your whole head is covered. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Wait 15-20 minutes and rinse out the mask.
steps.content: Wait 15-20 minutes and rinse out the mask. Run plenty of cool water through your mask-treated hair until it runs clear into your shower or tub. While you’re at it, apply some conditioner to keep your hair smooth and nourished. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Mix 1 egg with 2 US tbsp (30 mL) of olive oil.
steps.content: Mix 1 egg with 2 US tbsp (30 mL) of olive oil . Stir the egg and olive oil together until the yolk is completely broken up and the texture is consistent. If you have particularly dry or oily hair, make a quick tweak to your hair mask recipe: [11] X Research source Dry hair: Use 2 egg yolks instead of 1 egg Oily hair: Use 2 egg whites instead of 1 egg

steps.title: Apply the mask while you’re in the shower.
steps.content: Apply the mask while you’re in the shower. Lather your hair up with your go-to shampoo and rinse it out. Then, divide your hair into smaller sections and massage the oil-egg mixture into each one. For more even distribution, drag a wide-tooth comb through the strands after applying the mask. [12] X Research source You can also apply this mask out of the shower—just make sure that your hair is damp. It may seem a little strange to add olive oil to your hair, but there’s some science to back it up! According to one study, oil-treated hair isn’t as likely to get split ends. [13] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source

steps.title: Leave the mixture in your hair for 20 minutes and rinse it out.
steps.content: Leave the mixture in your hair for 20 minutes and rinse it out. Wash out the mixture under cool water until there’s no trace of egg or oil in your tub. Then, give your hair a few hours to air-dry. [14] X Research source
